ques.p: To ask the Scottish Executive how many local authorities have (a) committed to extending the contracts of cultural coordinators beyond the initial funding and (b) expressed this commitment in local outcome agreements.
To ask the Scottish Executive how many local authorities have given permanent employment status to cultural coordinators as of October 2010.
To ask the Scottish Executive how many cultural coordinators have permanent employment status as of October 2010.

reply.p: The Scottish Government announced in November in 2007 that central funding for the Cultural Coordinators in Scottish Schools (CCiSS) programme would be phased out from 2008. The programme formally ended in March 2010. Information on how individual local authorities are managing associated activity beyond the initial funding is not held centrally.

ques.p: To ask the Scottish Executive whether it will publish the data received in response to questions B34 to B39 and C24 to C32 in the survey undertaken on its behalf by George Street Research as part of the interim review of the Home Report.

reply.p: The survey results for questions B34 to B39 and C24 to C3, produced by George Street Research, have been published:
The remaining results for the same survey will be published at the same web page by the end of this month, November 2010.

ques.p: To ask the Scottish Executive how much has been spent on (a) public housing projects and (b) shared equity schemes in each year since 2007, broken down by local authority.

reply.p: Table 1 shows Scottish Government expenditure through the Affordable Housing Investment Programme (AHIP) in each year since 2007, broken down by local authority for (a) Housing Association rented projects and (b) Low Cost Home Ownership which includes both the New Supply Shared Equity (NSSE) and Shared Ownership schemes. Separate expenditure information specifically for New Supply Shared Equity schemes is not held centrally by local authority:
Note: *These figures are net of repayment of grant by Registered Social Landlords (RSLs) to reflect revisions to costs including sales income.
Table 2 shows total Scottish Government expenditure through the AHIP for the Open Market Shared Equity Pilot scheme (OMSEP) in each year since 2007, broken down by local authority.
*In 2007-08 this was known as the Homestake pilot programme and operated only in Edinburgh and the Lothians.
**The total spend figures exclude capital charges and receipts.
Table 3 shows total Scottish Government expenditure through the AHIP in each year since 2007, broken down by local authority and including the Council House Building programme.

tr.td: Open Market Shared Equity Pilot scheme (OMSEP)
Mortgage to Rent/ Home Owners Support Fund (HOSF)

reply.p: Note: *This figure relates to Fife Council only.
Further information on affordable housing spend can be found in the published annual out-turn report published on the Scottish Government website at:
